chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
instr: Set
data: Type
one_step: instr -> state -> state -> Prop
sss_fun: forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2
sss_dec: forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2}
P: code
ii: instr
st': state
st: state

Goal:
(fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> P // st :1> st' -> st ⟬ ii ⦒ st'

Premises:

fst : ?A * ?B -> ?A where ?A : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code ii : instr st : state st' : state |- Type] ?B : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i

VectorSpec.cons_inj : VectorDef.cons ?A ?a1 ?n ?v1 = VectorDef.cons ?A ?a2 ?n ?v2 -> ?a1 = ?a2 /\ ?v1 = ?v2 where ?A : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 ->...-> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code ii : instr st : state st' : state |- VectorDef.t ?A ?n]

EnvRing.PEsub : EnvRing.PExpr ?C -> EnvRing.PExpr ?C -> EnvRing.PExpr ?C where ?C : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code ii : instr st : state st' : state |- Type]
subcode : subcode.code ?X -> nat * list ?X -> Prop where ?X : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code ii : instr st : state st' : state |- Type]
EnvRing.PX : EnvRing.Pol ?C -> BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol ?C -> EnvRing.Pol ?C where ?C : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code ii : instr st : state st' : state |- Type]

VectorDef.splitat : forall l r : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (l + r) -> VectorDef.t ?A l * VectorDef.t ?A r where ?A : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code ii : instr st : state st' : state |- Type]
in_sss_step : forall (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (st1 st2 : state), fst st1 = k + length l -> st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (k, l ++ i :: r) // st1 :1> st2
sss_step = fun (P : code) (st1 st2 : state) => exists (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (d : data), P = (k, l ++ i :: r) /\ st1 = (k + length l, d) /\ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 : code -> state -> state -> Prop
sss_step_fun : forall (P : code) (s t1 t2 : state), P // s :1> t1 -> P // s :1> t2 -> t1 = t2
in_code_subcode : forall (X : Type) (i : nat) (P : subcode.code X), in_code i P -> exists a : X, (i, a :: nil) <sc P
subcode_cons_inj : forall (X : Type) (i : nat) (ρ δ : X) (P : subcode.code X), (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> (i, δ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ = δ
subcode_in_code : forall (X : Type) (P : subcode.code X) (Q : nat * list X) (i : nat), P <sc Q -> in_code i P -> in_code i Q
subcode_out_code : forall (X : Type) (P : subcode.code X) (Q : nat * list X) (i : nat), P <sc Q -> out_code i Q -> out_code i P
subcode_cons_invert_right : forall (X : Type) (j : nat) (J : X) (Q : list X) (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, J :: Q) -> i = j /\ I = J \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (S j, Q)
ZifyClasses.or_morph : forall s1 s2 t1 t2 : Prop, s1 < -> t1 -> s2 < -> t2 -> s1 \/ s2 < -> t1 \/ t2
ZifyClasses.and_morph : forall s1 s2 t1 t2 : Prop, s1 < -> t1 -> s2 < -> t2 -> s1 /\ s2 < -> t1 /\ t2
subcode_snoc_inv : forall (X : Type) (Q : subcode.code X) (i j : nat) (a l : list X), j = i + length l -> (i, l ++ a) <sc Q -> (j, a) <sc Q

unfold "<sc".
